image.altText: A young girl smiling

props.synopsis: Childhood dementia kills as many Australian children as cancer but the former receives much less funding.Â The South Australian government has stepped in to help families like Renee Staska whose three children are living with the illness.

title.children: Funding boost to childhood dementia research to help kids 'fulfil their dreams'

image.altText: A man walks through journalists and cameras.

props.synopsis: The documents reveal Bruce Lehrmann refused an offer to settle with Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson before his failed defamation case began hearings. In a submission to the Federal Court, Mr Lehrmann argues he should be compensated for his legal costs, stating Ten embarked on a qualified privilege defence which was "bound to fail".

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann refused offer to settle defamation action with Ten before trial began, court documents reveal

image.altText: Katherine Bennell-Pegg stands wearing a spacesuit.

props.synopsis: After 12 months walking underwater in spacesuits, undertaking simulated weightlessness flights, and learning to speak Russian, there is no certainty Katherine Bennell-Pegg will go to space. But she is first in line if Australia launches a mission.

title.children: Astronaut life 'absolutely as fun as you can imagine', Australian-first graduate tells kids

image.altText: Lines of solar panels on a paddock

props.synopsis: A five-hour drive from Sydney, a community garden of sorts has sprouted. But instead of sharing tomatoes or lettuce, "gardeners" harvest solar energy. And it's already a hit with people otherwise excluded from the rooftop solar boom.

title.children: On a patch of earth 'big as a Bunnings car park', renters get to muscle in on the solar boom

image.altText: Supermarket specials

props.synopsis: Research from consumer group Choice suggests some price labels at major supermarkets are misleading consumers, who believe they are receiving discounts when they are not.

title.children: Supermarket promotional labels accused of 'confusing' and 'potentially misleading' shoppers

image.altText: A man in a black shirt sits in the dark in front of a window.

props.synopsis: Australians are among the biggest users of ice in the world. Four Corners investigates where some of that crystal meth is coming from, and who's behind it.

title.children: 'I was making $40,000 a week': Former players in Australia's crystal meth underworld break their code of silence

image.altText: Court sketch of lawyers speaking as Donald Trump sits and listens in a court room

props.synopsis: A prosecutor lays out the "Trump Tower conspiracy", the former president's lawyers argue he's "cloaked in innocence", and a former titan of tabloid media educates jurors on chequebook journalism at the historic hush money trial in New York.Â

title.children: 'While salacious, does not matter': Porn star's claim under courtroom scrutiny as jurors hear openings in Trump's trial

image.altText: A man wearing football clothes

props.synopsis: West Adelaide footballer Sam May, 24, remains at the Royal Adelaide Hospital after an incident at Port Lincoln at the weekend. SA Police said emergency services were called to the Pier Hotel on Sunday morning after reports a man had fallen through the roof.

title.children: 'Sammy is the light of our lives': Footballer in hospital after incident at Port Lincoln hotel

image.altText: A man standing in a park

props.synopsis: The identity of Victorian man Steven Leslie Hainsworth â who is charged with murdering three South Australians between 1998 and 2011 â can be revealed for the first time.

title.children: Identity of alleged Victorian serial killer revealed after Supreme Court lifts suppression order

image.altText: A group of people climb a small hill in a line, under banana trees.

props.synopsis: Charlie Lynn led trekkers across the rugged Kokoda Track for three decades â but after one trip last year, he decided the mountainous trail had fallen too far into disrepair for him to return.

title.children: After 101 treks across the Kokoda Track, one guide says it's too full of 'death traps' to go back

image.altText: A woman in a bright red top stands in front of a camera inside a stadium

props.synopsis: ABC News South Asia bureau chief leaves India after being told a routine visa extension would be denied due to her reports on Sikh separatists.Â

title.children: 'It felt too difficult to do my job': ABC journalist targeted by Indian government over her reporting

image.altText: The PM speaking in front of a dark blue curtain.

props.synopsis: A federal senator has shared the unedited violent footage of the Wakeley church stabbing attack as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Elon Musk feud over X's bid to be able to host it on its site.

title.children: 'Ego, arrogance': PM responds to Elon Musk's comments goading him as senator posts graphic content

image.altText: Jim Chalmers speaks during a press conference.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says that over two budgets and a MYEFO the government has banked 88 per cent of revenue upgrades, compared to the Coalition's 40 per cent. RMIT ABC Fact Check runs the numbers.

title.children: Has Labor banked 88 per cent of budget revenue upgrades compared to the Coalition's 40 per cent?

image.altText: A profile image of a white woman with dark brown hair.

props.synopsis: From her early childhood well into adulthood, Susannah Breslin was studied by US researchers who became like parent figures to her. She has mixed feelings about the study's impact on her life.

title.children: Susannah was the subject of research for 30 years. It cost her her 'private life'

image.altText: A man holding a microphone on a stage

props.synopsis: A Melbourne mother says she felt intimidated after comedian Arj Barker asked her to leave his show after her baby started making noises during the performance. But some in the comedy field have backed his response.

title.children: Comedy figure says it should be 'a given' that babies aren't brought to gigs, after show ejection sparks debate

image.altText: A woman reads a piece of paper

props.synopsis: There is not one property across Australia that is affordable to someone on youth allowance, as experts call for the federal government to build 25,000 homes a year for the next two decades to ease the crisis.Â

title.children: 'Nothing short of horrifying': Rental affordability in Australia the worst it's ever been, report says

image.altText: A graph showing the rise and fall of the stock market as seen on a monitor

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 is trading higher after Wall Street's three major stock markets all finished higher overnight, while Crown Sydney has been allowed to keep its casino licence. Follow live.

title.children: ASX trading higher after positive session on Wall Street, Crown Sydney retains casino licence

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX remains elevated at lunch while Brambles dips after trading update
Star Entertainment chair privately suggested abolishing NSW independent casino regulator
'Suitable to retain': NSW regulator rubber-stamps Crown to operate a Sydney casino

image.altText: Catherine Wilson sits at a laptop in the background, in the foreground a wrestling belt sits on the table

props.synopsis: After months of back-and-forth with Facebook's customer support, Catherine Wilson now hates the platform and she's not alone. Complaints about scams targeting businesses on Facebook and Instagram are spiking and for many, it's a bigger fight to get the account back.

title.children: 'A total s***show': Companies losing money after being locked out of Facebook and Instagram

image.altText: A girl's arm with bites.

props.synopsis: Colleen Lavender has raised her kids to love the outdoors but they no longer walk around barefoot after her daughter disturbed a fire ant nest at a park.Â She's worried the spread of the ants could change the outdoor lifestyle Australians know and love.

title.children: Lily, 11, was playing in a park when fire ants swarmed her body

image.altText: Daniel Coward, Helen O'Sullivan and Surya McEwen standing side by side.

props.synopsis: Just weeksÂ after aid worker Zomi Frankcom was killed, three Australians are participating in an unauthorised mission to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza. As they sail to the coastal enclave, the government urges Australians "not to try and break the naval blockade".

title.children: Three Australian activists are sailing into a war zone. They think having the world's eyes on them will keep them safe

image.altText: cartoon of female ceo wearing apron

props.synopsis: This cartoon of a Victorian council's first female leader has fallen flat with women's advocates but the Australian Cartoonists Association says it is a depiction of the phrase "a new broom sweeps clean".Â

title.children: Cartoon depicting council's first female CEO wielding broom slammed as 'sexist trope'

image.altText: Elon Musk between the Twitter and X logos.

props.synopsis: Amid the rise of misinformation, disinformation and a reported increase in violent extremism online, can the government control what Australians see online?

title.children: What can the government do about X's refusal to take down violent videos?

image.altText: A dimly lit room showing rows of kitchen work benches featuring a gas stove and black knife block.

props.synopsis: By sponsoring the latest season of MasterChef, the gas industry is pushing back on the ban of gas appliances like stovetops to promote biomethane and hydrogen â but experts say it's a cynical attempt to maintain control of infrastructure.Â

title.children: Sponsorship of MasterChef by 'renewable gas' companies slammed as economically unviable 'greenwashing'

image.altText: Arisa Trew photographed in mid-air above her skateboard while doing a trick on the red carpet at the Laureus sport awards.

props.synopsis: Arisa Trew was just 13 years old when she became the first female skater to land a 720 in competition. Now, at the ripe old age of 14, she is honoured at the Laureus Sports Awards in Spain.Â

title.children: 'I've never met anyone like her': Australian 14-year-old honoured among sport's biggest stars

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Marta Dusseldorp starred as crown prosecutor Janet King for three years. Now she finds herself working more and more behind the camera.Â

title.children: 70-hour weeks and learning lines on the weekends: The real life of jobbing actor Marta Dusseldorp

image.altText: Shot of father carrying daughter who is wearing wide-brim hat, both are smiling

props.synopsis: Andrew Leech suffered with migraine for years. It was only when he studied to become a doctor that he realised help was out there. Now, he wants to make it easier to find relief.

title.children: It took this doctor more than a decade to find relief for his chronic migraine

image.altText: A fire truck is parked near a bus that has mounted the sidewalk.

props.synopsis: Brisbane's lord mayor has confirmed the bus crash that claimed the life of an 18-year-old woman was not due to a mechanical fault, with police set to re-enact the collision to determine the cause.Â

title.children: Part of Brisbane's CBD set to close as police re-enact bus crash that killed 18yo woman

image.altText: A group of young children lounge in front of a blue and white banner for UNRWA.

props.synopsis: A review commissioned in response to Israeli claims finds the UN agency for Palestinian refugees has more robust neutrality frameworks than similar groups, and that there is no evidence that hundreds of staff are involved with terrorist organisations.Â

title.children: Independent review of Palestinian refugee agency finds no evidence that hundreds of members are terrorists

image.altText: Image of Christopher Cash smiling into the camera.

props.synopsis: British police charge two men with spying for China, including one reported to have worked as a researcher in Britain's parliament for a prominent politician in the governing Conservative Party.Â

title.children: UK police charge two men with spying for China, including a parliamentary researcher

image.altText: Jake Stringer celebrates with Essendon teammates

props.synopsis: Much has been made of the 'Essendon edge'Â this season. But what exactly does the buzzword mean and how has it manifested in the club's surprisingly good start to the 2024?Â

title.children: 'Essendon edge' explained â The numbers behind Scott's Bomber revolution

image.altText: a sea of people

props.synopsis: There is a heightened awareness of personal safety following the high-profile deaths of three local women, support services say.

title.children: More women seeking family violence support following triple tragedy in Ballarat

image.altText: A fiery graphic reads "VS" with an image of Drake on the left and Kendrick Lamar the right

props.synopsis: Why are rap's biggest names fighting? And why is that good business for everyone involved? Here's your answers.

title.children: Drake and Kendrick Lamar's feud has dragged in everyone from The Weeknd to Taylor Swift and AI Snoop Dogg

image.altText: A man with short grey hair and glasses wearing a suit, sitting behind a microphone icking up a piece of paper as he speaks

props.synopsis: The former home affairs secretary had a decorated career in the public service before a series of leaked messages cost him his job. He now admits he has no one to blame but himself.Â

title.children: Former home affairs boss Pezzullo issues warning on China, admits his mistakes cost him his job

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking at a lecturn, looking on.

props.synopsis: Huw Edwards, the long-time BBC presenter often picked to anchor coverage of major news events, resigns nine months after he was the subject of a pornography scandal.

title.children: BBC presenter who announced Queen's death resigns months after explicit photo scandal

image.altText: Christine Thirkell sitting on a chair in her living room.

props.synopsis: An "alarming" new report has found an increasing number of employed Victorians are experiencing homelessness. Christine was one of them.

title.children: Christine is in stable housing now, but for a while she was among a 'growing crisis' of working homeless
